decks.notes: This deck revolves around utilizing Grand Arbiter Augustin IV's taxing ability to slow down opponents while maintaining control over the game. By playing cards that disrupt opponents' strategies, such as counterspells and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to control the battlefield and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan effectively. Additionally, the deck includes creatures with disruptive abilities like Meddling Mage and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to further hinder opponents. With a strong mix of control spells, disruptive creatures, and mana denial cards like Winter Orb and Armageddon, this deck aims to establish board dominance and outmaneuver opponents in a game of attrition.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the board through counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures while using Geist of Saint Traft as a win condition. The deck includes a variety of counterspells like Mana Leak, Force of Will, and Counterspell to disrupt opponents' plans and protect Geist of Saint Traft. It also has removal spells such as Swords to Plowshares and Wrath of God to deal with threats on the board. The inclusion of Stoneforge Mystic and equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Umezawa's Jitte provides additional tools for both offense and defense. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and slowly chip away at their life total with Geist of Saint Traft and other evasive creatures.

The deck focuses on generating value through powerful ramp spells and versatile control cards. It aims to accelerate mana production using various mana rocks and ramp spells like Cultivate and Kodama's Reach to cast high-impact threats such as Maelstrom Wanderer and Primeval Titan. The deck also includes a wide array of removal spells like Beast Within and Mizzium Mortars to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to provide card advantage and exert further control over the game. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of ramp, card advantage, and control elements.

The deck revolves around generating mana quickly and efficiently, ramping up to play powerful threats like Avenger of Zendikar and Craterhoof Behemoth. With Titania, Protector of Argoth as the commander, the deck focuses on creating tokens and taking advantage of land-based synergies. Cards like Primeval Titan and Oracle of Mul Daya help to ramp and ensure consistent land drops, while cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Birthing Pod provide flexibility and tutor options. The deck also includes ways to disrupt opponents' strategies, with cards like Tectonic Edge and Acidic Slime. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to ramp quickly, utilize land synergies, and overwhelm opponents with a swarm of tokens and powerful creatures.

This deck is focused on aggressive plays and overwhelming the opponent with a variety of efficient white creatures and powerful equipment. Brimaz, King of Oreskos serves as the commander, providing a strong presence on the battlefield. The deck includes a mix of early game cards like Martyr of Sands and Deftblade Elite, as well as late-game threats such as Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite and Sun Titan. The inclusion of powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Sword of War and Peace allows for additional damage and protection. Control elements such as Swords to Plowshares and Wrath of God help clear the way for the aggressive creatures to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to create a powerful combo using Prossh, Skyraider of Kher as the commander. The deck includes various mana accelerants like Elves of Deep Shadow and Fyndhorn Elves, along with tutors like Demonic Tutor and Worldly Tutor to find key pieces of the combo quickly. The combo involves sacrificing creatures to generate mana and tokens with Prossh, while also utilizing Purphoros, God of the Forge and other cards like Beastmaster Ascension and Pattern of Rebirth to deal damage and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes removal and disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Terminate to control the game and protect the combo until it can be executed for a game-winning play.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana and quickly ramping up to play powerful creatures and spells. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats, utilizing cards like Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary and Priest of Titania to accelerate mana production. Titania, Protector of Argoth acts as the commander, providing a powerful late-game threat that can create an army of elemental tokens. With cards like Primeval Titan, Craterhoof Behemoth, and Avenger of Zendikar, the deck aims to quickly close out games with explosive plays. Additionally, the deck includes utility cards like Thrun, the Last Troll and Reclamation Sage to disrupt opponents' strategies and maintain board presence.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and burn spells to apply pressure on the opponent and quickly reduce their life total to zero. It utilizes efficient low-cost creatures like Zurgo Bellstriker and Goblin Guide, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Searing Blaze to deal damage directly to the opponent or remove any blockers. The deck aims to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent to make unfavorable trades, while also having access to powerful finishers like Hellrider and Hell's Thunder to seal the deal. By maintaining a fast and relentless pace, the deck can overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize and turn the tide in their favor.
